column1: \item ATTENTION: Not suitable for children under 3 years
column2: choking hazard due to small parts that may be swallowed.

column1: \item We recommend: Supervision of the assembly and soldering process by an adult.
\item Keep these operating instructions in a safe place for later use! It contains important information.
\item Magnets are included in the kit. Magnets are not toys! Make sure that the magnets do not get into the hands of children. Children can swallow small magnets. If several magnets are swallowed
column2: they can become lodged in the intestines and cause life-threatening complications.

column1: \item Magnets can affect the function of pacemakers and implanted defibrillators. A pacemaker can be switched to test mode and cause discomfort. A defibrillator may no longer function. As the wearer of such devices
column2: keep a sufficient distance from magnets. Warn wearers of such devices against approaching magnets.
strong magnetic field. They can damage televisions and laptops
column8: among other things. Keep magnets away from all devices and objects that can be damaged by strong magnetic fields.

column1: \item Neodymium magnets are brittle. If two magnets collide
column2: they can shatter. Sharp-edged splinters can be thrown meters away and injure your eyes. Avoid collisions between magnets. Wear safety goggles when handling large magnets. Make sure that bystanders are also protected or keep their distance.
replace it only with a new battery with the same values.

column3: the solder and also the components being soldered become very hot.

column1: \item Always wear safety glasses when soldering and assembling the kit.
\item Always use a fire proof soldering pad when soldering! This prevents the components from slipping away.
\item To keep the soldering iron safe during assembly
column2: always use a suitable soldering stand.

column1: \item The kit is designed for USB power only. Use appropriate power supply.
\item CAUTION: Never connect the kit to 230 V mains voltage! There is an absolute danger to life!
\item Please take the device to appropriately certified disposal companies at the end of its service life. This is good for the environment and ensures correct disposal.

This appliance is labelled in accordance with the European Directive 2012/19/EU on waste electrical and electronic equipment (WEEE). The directive provides the legal framework for the take-back and recycling of waste equipment throughout the EU.
\item \textbf{packaging}: The packaging is made of environmentally friendly materials and is therefore recyclable. Dispose of packaging materials that are no longer needed accordingly.
\item \textbf{waste equipment}: Old appliances often still contain valuable materials. Therefore
column2: hand in your old appliance to your retailer or a recycling centre for reuse. Please ask your retailer or your local authority for the current disposal routes.
